<div class="tourbrd">
<h1>Rajasthan Cultural Tour Package</h1>
<p><span><a href="/" title="Home">Home</a> » <a href="/india-tour-packages" title="India Tour Packages">India</a> » <a href="/rajasthan-tour-packages" title="Rajasthan Tour Packages">Rajasthan</a> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">Rajasthan Cultural Tour Package</span></span></p>
</div>

</div>

</div>
<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c2e7e626948_93450649" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">
<div id="tourflexBox2" class="cmsmasters_row_outer_parent">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_outer">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_inner">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_margin">
<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/rajasthan-group.jpg" alt="Rajasthan Group Tour Package" title="Rajasthan Group Tour Package" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>Rajasthan takes great pride in its regal culture, traditions, customs, and rich history. The magnificent Havelis, majestic forts, opulent palaces, and vibrant folk culture have always captivated visitors. The Rajasthan Heritage & Culture Tour offers a remarkable journey through the renowned cities of Rajasthan, allowing you to delve into everything they are renowned for. This twelve-day excursion promises not only exceptional sightseeing at historical monuments but also the opportunity to experience a camel ride in the desert. Additionally, you will have the chance to explore Old Delhi, with its splendid Mughal-era structures such as the Red Fort and Jama Mosque, which attract a large number of tourists. This tour guarantees an abundance of thrilling adventures and unforgettable sightseeing experiences.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Rajasthan Cultural Tour Itinerary Package</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Delhi – Mandawa/ 256 Km- 5 HRS</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>On arrival at Delhi, Namaste India Trip Representative will greet you and Drive to Mandawa in Rajasthan. Check in at a heritage hotel for dinner and overnight stay.</p>
<p>Mandawa:  In the heart of the Shekhawati region of Rajasthan lies the beautiful small town Mandawa, known throughout the state for its forts and Havelis. Mandawa is situated in the north Indian state of Rajasthan around 190 km from Jaipur, the capital of the state.</p>
</p></div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Mandawa – Bikaner/ 193-4 HRS</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Morning After breakfast drive to Bikaner. Check in at a hotel on arrival. Later visit local sightseeing. Overnight stay.</p>
<p>Tour the Junagarh Fort that was built by Raja Rai Singh; see the Lalgarh Palace that was constructed by Maharaja Ganga Singhji. The other attractions you may tour the Camel Breeding Farm, Karni Mata Temple etc. Stay overnight at the hotel in Bikaner.</p>
<p>Bikaner: If ever beauty has bloomed in a desert, it has been at Bikaner. Founded in 1488 AD by Rao Bika Ji, it’s located in North West part of Rajasthan state in INDIA. The imposing palaces, beautiful and richly sculptured temples of red and yellow sandstones display some of the finest creations of Rajput civilization. It’s lust for “dessert” or affection for “desert” that tickles every heart to visit Bikaner.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Bikaner- Jaisalmer/ 329 KM- 5.5 HRS</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Morning half Day visit fabulous Junagarh Fort & Lalgarh Palace and proceed for Jaisalmer. Visit Kheechan on the way, and reach Jaisalmer Check-in at hotel in Jaisalmer. Overnight stay at Jaisalmer.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Jaisalmer – Local Sightseeing</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Visit Jaisalmer Fort & Museum after breakfast. Also see the Jain Temple. Take a walk through the back streets to the Patwon ki Haveli & Kothari Haveli. After lunch proceed to Kuldhera – an abandoned habitation, and then to Sam Sand Dunes. Here camp stay will be provided with folk dance and songs with Rajasthani Dinner.</p>
<p>Sam Sand Dunes: Sam sand dunes are becoming the major attraction in Jaisalmer. This is the closest place from where you can lose yourself in ‘the Great Thar Desert’. Sam has a truly magnificent stretch of sweeping dunes, with sparse or no vegetation.</p>
</p></div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Jaisalmer – Pokhran – Jodhpur/307 KM-6 HRS</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Morning, after breakfast transfer to Jodhpur, The Sun City. On the way to Jodhpur, you can have your lunch at Fort Pokhran which literally means the palace of five mirages. Enroute you can also visit Bishnoi Villages where people believe in conserving natural environment and animal hunting is banned there. You can spot numerous deer in Bishnoi Village. Arrive Jodhpur and get assisted check into the hotel. After taking some rest in the hotel we begin the city tour of Jodhpur which comprises of visit to the impressive Mehrangarh Fort – This magnificent fort was built in the 15th century and has seven gates which still witness marks of the battle fought by armies of Jodhpur to protect their people, Jaswant Thada – Looks like a temple, this white marble was constructed in the memory of Maharaja Jaswant Singh II, last but not to miss is Umaid Bhawan Palace – This stunning palace which today also serves as the residence to the royal family and a part of it is transformed into a luxurious hotel. The evening is free to relax and overnight stay is in Jodhpur.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>Jodhpur – Kumbhalgarh/186 Km-4 Km</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today we drive from Jodhpur to Kumbhalgarh…after arrival, we straightaway go to the hotel & check-in. in the evening at around 4, we go and visit the Majestic Kumbhalgarh Fort. Claimed to be the largest fortification in the world only second to The Great Wall Of China. After a couple of hours at the fort, we return back to our Hotel. Dinner & overnight at hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>Kumbhalgarh – Ranakpur – Udaipur/ 101 Km- 2 Hrs</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Renowned for their exquisite carved work in marble and a center for Jain pilgrimage as well. On arrival at Udaipur, check into a hotel for overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Udaipur</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>The city of lakes- Udaipur is a fascinating city to explore. With its intriguing blend of sights, sounds and experience- Udaipur is a tourist’s delight. Enjoy a boat ride on the placid waters of Lake Pichola and in the afternoon and visit the City Palace, Jagdish Temple, Sahelion-Ki-Bari and Bharatiya Lok Kala Museum as well as the island palaces of Jag Mandir and Jag Niwas. Overnight stay at the hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 9 :</span>Travel to Bundi via Chittorgarh/273 KM-5 Hrs</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today transfer to Bundi (260 kms – 6 hrs). Bundi is a heritage town full of charming heritage monuments. Later take a heritage walk to explore the heritage character of the area. Visit Monuments such as Sukh Mahal (Small Palace) , Maharao Raja Bahadur Singh Museum (Part of Moti Mahal full of stuffed wildlife, royal portraits and royal weapons on display) Chitrasala (18th-century monument covered in beautiful paintings), Bundi Palace etc. Overnight stay at Bundi.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 10 :</span>Bundi – Ranthambore/126 Km- 3 Hrs</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today we will move towards Ranthambore. On arrival Check-in and relax till evening. In the evening, venture out to Ranthambore National Park (Jungle Safari made available on direct payment basis and is subject to availability). Later, return to the hotel for a comfortable overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 11 :</span>Ranthambore Local</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Take an early morning jeep safari/canter ride to the Ranthambore Tiger Reserve (on direct payment basis). Return to the hotel for breakfast. Visit the Ganesh temple inside the Ranthambore Fort. Take another ride into the thick forest area during early evening. Stay overnight at the hotel in Ranthambore.</p>
<p>Morning, leave for Agra. Enroute visit the abandoned Mughal city of Fatehpur Sikri, built by Emperor Akbar in 1569, was the old capital of the Mughals, which was abandoned after 15 years due to scarcity of water. Agra fort See the graceful buildings including the Jama Masjid, Tomb of Salim Chisti, Panch Mahal & other Palaces which are still preserved in its original glory. Continue drive to Agra. Arrive Agra and check-in at prebooked hotel. Rest of the day at leisure.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 12 :</span>Ranthambore – Fatehpur Sikri – Agra</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Morning, leave for Agra. Enroute visit the abandoned Mughal city of Fatehpur Sikri: built by Emperor Akbar in 1569, was the old capital of the Mughals, which was abandoned after 15 years due to scarcity of water. Agra fort See the graceful buildings including the Jama Masjid, Tomb of Salim Chisti, Panch Mahal & other Palaces which are still preserved in its original glory. Continue drive to Agra. Arrive Agra and check-in at prebooked hotel. Rest of the day at leisure.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 13 :</span>Agra – Delhi/210 kms / 4-5 hours</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After breakfast, city tour of Agra. Visit Red Fort, which was built by Emperor Akbar in 1565, and additions were made up until the time of his grandson, Shah Jahan. It contains the hall of public and private audiences amongst many other beautiful structures; Itmad-ud-daulah, which was constructed by Nur Jahan between 1622 and 1628 and is very similar to the tomb she constructed for her husband, Jehangir, near Lahore in Pakistan; the highlight of the day – The Taj Mahal, which was constructed by Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal. Construction of the Taj began in 1631 and was not completed until 1653.</p>
<p>Afternoon, leave for Delhi enroute visit Sikandra – Mughal Emperor Akbar’s Mausoleum. Continue to drive to Delhi.  Arrive Delhi and check-in at hotel. Overnight stay at Delhi.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 14 :</span>Delhi City Tour</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today you are fully Free For shopping at Chandni Chowk, Lajpat Nagar and Karol Bagh. Overnight stay at Delhi.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 15 :</span>Delhi Departure</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Today after breakfast, transfer to the airport/ Railway station for your onward destination.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Rajasthan Cultural Package</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Months Are Ideal For A Rajasthan Tour?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Tourists visit Rajasthan all year, but the best time to visit is during the winter months of November to February, when the temperatures are not too hot. Temperatures can vary dramatically between day and night during December and January.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is Most Common In Rajasthan?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Rajasthan produces nearly all of the country's calcite and natural gypsum. Asbestos, copper concentrate, ochre, Phosphorite/rock phosphate, silver, steatite, ball clay, fluorite, and feldspar are all major products of the state. The state is also a major producer of marble in a variety of colours.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Month Has The Most Rain In Rajasthan?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The majority of the southwest monsoon rains in Rajasthan fall between July and August.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Rajasthan Has Three Types Of Forests?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Tropical dry and deciduous forest covers a large area of the state from east to south-east and includes many forests such as Dry teak, Salar, Bamboo, Dhokra, Palash, Khair, Babul, and Mixed deciduous forest.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Why Is Rajasthan Famous For Its Cuisine?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Rajasthani cuisine is influenced by the state's rich heritage and arid climate. Their cuisine is distinguished by the scarcity of fresh fruits and vegetables. Beans, lentils, gramme flour, corn, barley, millet, Bajra, bread, and dairy products are all common ingredients especially Ghee.</p>
</p></div></div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
